snippet: Some of Japan’s largest manufacturers are contributing to a $1.8 billion bailout of the struggling chip maker Renesas, a move that will give the government and the companies a 69 percent stake.
abstract: Some of Japan’s largest manufacturers are contributing to a $1.8 billion bailout of the struggling chip maker Renesas, a move that will give the government and the companies a 69 percent stake.
lead_paragraph: Some of Japan’s largest manufacturers are contributing to a $1.8 billion bailout of the struggling chip maker Renesas, a move that will give the government and the companies a 69 percent stake, reports Hiroko Tabuchi of The New York Times from Tokyo. Read more »

headline.main: Japanese Manufacturers Rescue Chip Maker Renesas
